name: English Phrasal Verbs
description: Common English phrasal verbs. Memorize the verb (Side A) and its meanings or examples (Side B).

sideB: Example: The kids really look up to their teacher.
Example: Don't bring up politics at dinner.
Example: I came across these old photos while cleaning.
To have a friendly relationship with someone.
Example: Do you get along with your new colleagues?
Example: He didn't give up, even when it was difficult.
To have no more of something left.
Example: We've run out of milk, I need to go to the store.
To refuse an offer or request.
Example: She had to turn down the job offer.
To find a solution to a problem.
Example: I try to work out three times a week.
